page.title: 07Papermill Farm
page.content: {Papermill Farm}is part of the{Stanway {Estate.}Its farmhouse was built in the 13th. century and the farm was founded in about 1635. It is owned by{Lord and {Lady Neidpath.}The tenant, Sheila Sadler, runs the farm. Her family has worked at the farm since 1946. They have 245 acres of land and own 22 cattle, 800 sheep, 8 geese, 5 goslings 12 horses, a sheep dog and a bull. The animals are fed on hay, straw, potatoes, cattle cake, sugar beet and minerals. There are 4 different types of cattle, Friesian, Charolais, Jersey and Hereford. In the shearing season they can shear 85 sheep a day. They keep the fleece in wool sheets. 25 fleeces can be kept in one sheet. 2 people work on the farm with the animals. They work every day of the week including Sundays.
